articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Ukrainian drone has struck Grozny, the capital of Russia's southern Chechnya region, and caused civilian casualties, state news agency RIA quoted Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov as saying on Wednesday.
articles.title: Chechen leader Kadyrov says Ukrainian drone causes civilian casualties

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks pushed into northern parts of the Khan Younis area in the south of the Gaza Strip on Wednesday and Palestinian medics said Israeli airstrikes had killed at least 20 people across the enclave.
articles.title: Israeli forces advance in Khan Younis area of southern Gaza, 20 killed across enclave

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden arrived in the Angolan port city of Lobito on Wednesday, the last day of a trip to Africa, to tout a plan to extend a railway that could channel critical minerals from Congo to the West.
articles.title: Biden visits Angolan port city of Lobito to tout railway plans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The no-confidence motions are all but certain to oust the government, throwing the euro zone's second-biggest economy deeper into a lingering political crisis.
articles.title: French lawmakers set to vote on ousting Prime Minister Barnier

articles.author: Amina Niasse, Kyoko Gasha
articles.description: Brian Thompson, the CEO of UnitedHealth's insurance unit, was fatally shot on Wednesday morning outside a midtown Manhattan hotel, several media outlets reported, just before a scheduled company investor conference.
articles.title: UnitedHealthcare executive fatally shot in Manhattan, reports say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli attacks on Lebanon have killed 4,047 people and wounded 16,638 others since Oct. 7, 2023, Lebanese Health Minister Firass Abiad said in a televised press conference on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israeli attacks have killed 4,047 people in Lebanon, Lebanese minister says

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Intense airstrikes overnight drove Syrian rebels back from the edge of Hama, a major city whose fall would pile pressure on President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Syrian military and rebels battle north of Hama

articles.author: Candelaria Grimberg
articles.description: Argentina's libertarian President Javier Milei, increasingly a poster child for rightwing politics and free-markets, is hosting allies of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and Brazil's Jair Bolsonaro at a summit in Buenos Aires on Wednesday.
articles.title: Argentina's Milei hosts Trump allies, Bolsonaro clan at right-wing summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas said it had information that Israel intended to carry out a hostage rescue operation similar to one conducted in Gaza's Nuseirat camp in June and threatened to "neutralize" the captives if such an operation took place, according to an internal statement seen by Reuters on Wednesday.
articles.title: Hamas threatens to 'neutralize' hostages if Israel launches rescue - Hamas internal statement

articles.author: Dave Sherwood, Marc Frank
articles.description: Cuba's national electrical system collapsed early on Wednesday morning after the country's largest power plant failed, the government said, the latest of several such failures as the island's grid falls into disarray amid fuel shortages, natural disaster and economic crisis.
articles.title: Cuba's electric grid collapses after power plant failure, millions without light
